page.title: 01FARMLAND,NORTH CAVE,HOTHAM
page.content: The block is chiefly agricultural land containing the villages of North Cave and Hotham and crossed by secondary roads. The M62 is nearby. People from both villages commute to work in Hull and Brough. Hotham retains its rural charm with one main street, a post office, pub and two large country houses. Both villages have becks and ponds. Traffic bustles along Westgate with its three general stores and lots of houses. Church Street and Nordham run parallel to this and are a mixture of old, new and renovated properties. The old water mills lie between Church Street and Nordham with the church nearby. Station Road was named before the Hull-Barnsley line was closed and links North and South Cave. Some villagers were born here, others have moved here because of its attraction.
